channel.title: Computer Overheat?
channel.description: Will your computer overheat? to much if you leave it on for like every day as i leave mine on for every day.

item.title: Computer Overheat?
item.dc:creator: @BlazezFire BlazezFire
item.description:
@BlazezFire wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Should it overheat? No. Can it or will it? Depends on if you have enough fans and circulation.

Oh i see.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Overheat?
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

If the computer does not suck you can usually configure through the BIOS to do a hard shut-down if the processor temperature reaches a certain limit. That limit should never be reached under normal circumstances, but if the room is especially hot and the computer is working at max / the fans are broken or don’t work properly / the air flow is blocked, it can happen. Leaving the computer turned on for a long time simply increases the chances.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Overheat?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“magma, post:1, topic:241650”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=317427.msg2522287#msg2522287 date=1225952217]

My server temperature is around 30-35C, then goes up to around 40-45C if there’s an attack or I messed up and sent the server into a spasm.

Your computer wont just overheat, or ‘burnout’ as the bill payer likes to call it - If your cooling system is any good it will cool your computer at the same rate whether it’s been on for two days or a month. But then again, computers have a lifespan and your computer wont last as long if you leave it on all day. It’s usually the hard disks that wear out and die anyway, not the cpu exploding.

Think about it though:
0mins to 5mins: Core 20C
5mins to 10mins: Core 30C
10mins to 30mins: Temperature averages at around 30-35C
30mins to 1 hour: Still same temperature as above, fans still running etc.
5 hours later: Provided you didn’t stab a pencil into the fan or chuck your bag onto the top outlet it’ll still be the same.
24 hours later: " "
etc etc.

Mine is at around 37C at 0mins.

I once got my server stuck at 100% CPU for like a week (I fucked up a PHP loop), and it stayed at 37C.
[/quote]
Uh, doesn’t that make you think that there could be something wrong with the reading?[/quote]
Nope. I made a php loop wrong. It totally locked up apache.

Read full topic

Think about it though:

item.title: Computer Overheat?
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Water cooling FTW.

Moparisthebest:

Should it overheat? No. Can it or will it? Depends on if you have enough fans and circulation.

item.title: Computer Overheat?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Its very likely your computers life will be shortened considerably if you do this. Also if you have a well built computer taking the sides off your computer to cool it probably isn’t the best idea.

However I always take the sides off and aim desk fans in to my computer, it get to about 80C playing most demanding games.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Overheat?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

i didn’t say Celsius, i said percentage of the CPU load. It should never go over 40c on each core if your just idling.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:

My comp never reaches 60C… Even when I play crysis. But my laptop, however, idles (05%) at around 80C.

item.title: Computer Overheat?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

If your computer is just idling, not running some sort of high end game, or anything that keeps ur CPU running over 60% 24/7, then it should be fine.
